question: A train covers a certain distance in 210 minutes at a speed of 60  km/hr. The time taken by the train, to covers the same distance at a speed of 80  km/hr is :
explanation:
Speed of train = 60 km/hr
Time $latex = 210\\ minutes = \\frac{210}{60} = \\frac{7}{2}\\ hours&s=1$
Distance covered $latex = 60\\times \\frac{7}{2} = 210\\ km&s=1$
Time taken at 80 km/hr $latex = \\frac{210}{80} = \\frac{21}{8} = 2\\frac{5}{8}\\ hours&s=1$
Hence option [B] is correct answer.
